title: A test post
text:
Read the following and see if you can answer the question:


There are three boxes in a stack. A pink one, a purple one and a green one. The pink one is in the middle of the stack with the purple below it. What is the color of the box on the bottom of the stack?

Most likely you answered purple‚Ä¶
But it is possible you first said green (don‚Äôt worry if you did it is quite a common response!)


It‚Äôs a verbal visual problem that requires some deliberation and most likely for us to create a visual image of a stack of boxes as a reasoning aid.
Notice also the complexity of the language used in the prompt to describe the scene. The use of natural language as opposed to a formal/logical calculus does hold the potential for ambiguity (multiple interpretations) and inexactness. However, it is the most normal/natural, efficient and broadly accessible way of communicating such information.
Notice 1. The use of anaphor or reference. - Three BOXES -> a pink/purple/green ONE as opposed to a pink box, a purple box and a green box. - The PINK ONE is in the middle ... the purple {BOX} below IT {the pink box}
We tend to try and avoid this kind of repetition to make our speech more coherent.

Although the description in language may not be entirely concise, there is no real ambiguity as to how the boxes can be arranged. It must be: | Box | Stack position | | ‚Äî | ‚Äî | | GREEN | top | | PINK | middle | | PURPLE | bottom |




GPT3.5 Turbo

Had some difficulties and answered green
Llama2 (chat 7B version)


Answered correctly (purple) and used some so-called chain-of-thought reasoning

Bing Chat (MS Co-pilot)
This LLM is GPT4 with some Microsoft specific tuning and RAG (search) additions.
It get‚Äôs it correct:

The color of the box on the bottom of the stack is purple. This is because the purple box is below the pink one, which is in the middle of the stack. Therefore, the purple box must be the lowest one. üü™

But when you follow up and ask it to create visual representation of the box arrangement

PROMPT: Can you create a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged?

It responds

RESPONSE: Sure, I‚Äôll try to create that. Here is a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged:

And uses DALL-E3 to create 4 different attempts at a visual representation:

NONE OF WHICH ARE CORRECT!!!

title: Valentine‚Äôs Day Date
text: Planning a date can be a lot of work, especially for a special occasion like Valentine‚Äôs Day. There are so many options from a romantic night out to a cozy night in, and there are so many considerations to think of such as setting, gifts, what to say, what to wear. Let‚Äôs see if GPT can help us design a memorable night for the occasion!

title: Valentine‚Äôs Day Date
text: Planning a date can be a lot of work, especially for a special occasion like Valentine‚Äôs Day. There are so many options from a romantic night out to a cozy night in, and there are so many considerations to think of such as setting, gifts, what to say, what to wear. Let‚Äôs see if GPT can help us design a memorable night for the occasion!

title: Valentine‚Äôs Day Date
text:
Let‚Äôs Go!

Help me plan a Valentine‚Äôs Day date


That sounds great! To make it special, tell me a bit about what you and your partner enjoy. Do you prefer something romantic and traditional, adventurous and unique, or cozy and low-key? Also, would you like to stay in or go out? Let me know your budget, and I can tailor the plan to make it perfect!


GPT asked me for any preferences that could inform its generation of a date before launching into a plan.
This was quite interesting because it recognizes that much thought should be put into planning a date, and there is no one formulaic answer that fits all couples.
This is a similar response that I would expect from a real person as well: a question about what my date is like to help guide the advice that follows.
However, I was not going to let GPT off the hook that easily. I wanted to see what it would come up with with no guidance at all.


Give me some options for each

Here, GPT generated a compreheensive list of ideas for my night:

Here are some great Valentine‚Äôs Day date ideas, tailored to different vibes. Pick the one that fits you best!



Romantic & Traditional
‚ù§Ô∏è Fancy Dinner Date ‚Äì Book a reservation at a high-end restaurant or a cozy, candle-lit spot. Bonus: Call ahead to arrange for a special dessert or flowers at the table.
‚ù§Ô∏è Scenic Picnic ‚Äì Pack a basket with wine, cheese, and chocolates. Choose a beach, park, or hilltop for sunset vibes.
‚ù§Ô∏è Horse-Drawn Carriage Ride ‚Äì Many cities offer carriage rides through scenic areas‚Äîsuper romantic!
‚ù§Ô∏è Rooftop or Balcony Dinner ‚Äì If you want something private, set up a romantic dinner with fairy lights and music at home.



Adventurous & Unique
üî• Hot Air Balloon Ride ‚Äì If available, this is a breathtaking way to celebrate!
üî• Escape Room Date ‚Äì Test your teamwork with a fun and thrilling challenge.
üî• Nighttime Kayaking or Stargazing Hike ‚Äì Bring some blankets, hot cocoa, and enjoy the stars.
üî• Amusement Park or Arcade Date ‚Äì For a fun and playful evening, challenge each other to games and win prizes.



Cozy & Low-Key
üíñ Movie Night at Home ‚Äì Create a ‚Äúhome theater‚Äù with fairy lights, a blanket fort, and homemade popcorn.
üíñ DIY Spa Night ‚Äì Give each other massages, use face masks, and unwind with candles and soft music.
üíñ Fondue & Wine Night ‚Äì Melt some chocolate or cheese and dip strawberries, marshmallows, or bread.
üíñ Love Letter Exchange & Memory Lane Night ‚Äì Write heartfelt letters to each other, then read them over a bottle of wine.



Stay-In vs.¬†Go-Out

Want to stay in? A homemade dinner with a candle-lit setup, movie night, or game night can be just as romantic as going out.

Want to go out? Consider a jazz lounge, rooftop bar, or a staycation at a fancy hotel for something extra special.

What‚Äôs your vibe? I can help you customize it further! üòä

I found GPT‚Äôs answer to be quite complete giving me a wide variety of options, from some classic date ideas for a traditional romantic night, some more unique date ideas for if I was feeling adventurous, and some low-key date ideas if I was feeling llike a cozy night in.
GPT sorted the date eideas by vibe rather than other considerations such as budget. I, too, would consider the vibe of the datee as the most important aspeect.
I was quite impressed with the variety that it generated, and I see how at leeast one of these date ideas would fit most couples, no maater what their vibe was. I would actually love to go on any of these dates.

Next, I wanted to see if it could go more in depth about a specific date i selected, so I asked it to tell me more about the date I would have picked from this list.

I like the dinner date, tell me more


A romantic dinner date is always a classic and memorable choice! Here are some ways to make it extra special, whether you‚Äôre dining out or setting up something intimate at home.




Option 1: Fancy Restaurant Dinner
‚úî Choose the Perfect Spot ‚Äì Pick a restaurant with a romantic ambiance (dim lighting, soft music, scenic views). If unsure, I can help you find top-rated places near you.
‚úî Make a Reservation in Advance ‚Äì Valentine‚Äôs Day is a busy night, so book ahead! Some places offer special Valentine‚Äôs menus.
‚úî Plan a Surprise Touch ‚Äì Call the restaurant to request a special dessert, flower arrangement, or a handwritten note on the table.
‚úî Dress to Impress ‚Äì Dress up in your best outfit for the occasion.
‚úî Personalized Gift or Gesture ‚Äì Maybe bring a small gift (a handwritten love note, favorite chocolates, or a single rose).
‚úî After-Dinner Plans ‚Äì If you want to extend the night, follow up with a romantic walk, rooftop drinks, or a stargazing spot.



Option 2: Romantic Dinner at Home
üåπ Decorate the Space ‚Äì Set the mood with candles, fairy lights, rose petals, and soft music. Dim the lights for a cozy ambiance.
üç∑ Cook a Special Meal Together ‚Äì Choose a three-course meal (appetizer, main dish, dessert) or recreate a dish from your favorite restaurant.
üé∂ Create a Romantic Playlist ‚Äì Soft jazz, acoustic love songs, or your special couple songs work perfectly.
üçΩ Elegant Table Setting ‚Äì Use nice plates, cloth napkins, wine glasses, and maybe a handwritten menu.
üçì Fun Add-Ons ‚Äì End the night with chocolate-covered strawberries, a DIY cocktail-making session, or a love letter exchange.
üíå Surprise Element ‚Äì Hide a little love note or a meaningful gift under their plate or on their chair.



Bonus Additions to Elevate the Date

Personal Chef Experience ‚Äì Hire a chef to cook at home for a luxurious touch.

Dinner & a Movie Theme ‚Äì Cook a meal that matches a movie (Italian dinner + Roman Holiday or sushi + Lost in Translation).

Blindfolded Taste Test Game ‚Äì Turn your dinner into a playful experience by feeding each other different foods.

Wine or Cocktail Pairing ‚Äì Choose wines that pair with each course, or mix cocktails together.

Would you like restaurant recommendations or recipe ideas for a home-cooked meal? Let me know how you‚Äôd like to personalize it! üòä

Again, GPT offered me multiple options based on the vibe I wanted to acheive
It also included advice for each date:

For a night out, it recommended making a reservation and planning a surprise or gift
For a night in, it gave specific ideas for decorating the space and potential treate to prepare

GPT was surprisingly thoughtful for recommending to bring a gift in addition to planning the date.

I wanted to see how detailed I could get GPT to plan, so I asked for a timeline for this date. > Give me a structured schedule for the date with times

Here‚Äôs a structured schedule for your romantic Valentine‚Äôs Day dinner date, whether you‚Äôre dining out or staying in. Choose the version that suits you best!

title: Valentine‚Äôs Day Date
text:
Option 1: Fancy Restaurant Dinner Date
üìç Location: Your chosen restaurant

Schedule:

6:00 PM ‚Äì Get ready

Dress up in your best outfit

Write a small love note or bring a tiny surprise gift (optional)

6:45 PM ‚Äì Travel to the restaurant

Arrive a bit early to check in and get settled

7:00 PM ‚Äì Arrive & be seated

Order drinks & enjoy a toast to each other

7:15 PM ‚Äì Appetizer & conversation

Talk about happy memories & what you love about each other

7:45 PM ‚Äì Main course & deeper conversations

Maybe reminisce about how you met, future plans, or bucket list dreams

8:30 PM ‚Äì Dessert & surprise moment

If you arranged a surprise (custom dessert, note from you, etc.), it arrives now

9:00 PM ‚Äì After-dinner plans

Take a romantic walk, visit a rooftop bar, or find a cozy dessert caf√©

Option: Head home for a movie, slow dancing, or wine by candlelight

title: Valentine‚Äôs Day Date
text:
Option 2: Romantic Dinner at Home
üìç Location: Your home (set up for a cozy, candle-lit dinner)

Schedule:

5:00 PM ‚Äì Set up the space

Dim the lights, set candles, play soft music

Arrange the table with nice dishes, wine glasses, and decorations

5:30 PM ‚Äì Start cooking together (if cooking)

Make it fun: sip wine, dance in the kitchen, take turns cooking

6:45 PM ‚Äì Get dressed for the evening

Even at home, dressing up adds to the romance

7:00 PM ‚Äì Enjoy appetizers

Light bites like a cheese board, shrimp cocktail, or bruschetta

7:30 PM ‚Äì Serve the main course

Pair with wine or a signature cocktail

8:15 PM ‚Äì Dessert & special moment

Surprise them with a handwritten letter, a small gift, or a toast

8:45 PM ‚Äì Cozy time

Choose between slow dancing, a movie night, a love letter exchange, or a DIY spa night

10:00 PM ‚Äì Wind down together

Cuddle with a warm drink, talk about future plans, or stargaze outside





Extra Touches (for either option)
üíå Love Letter Exchange ‚Äì Read letters to each other over dessert
üì∏ Photo Booth ‚Äì Take some cute couple pictures to remember the night
üé∂ First Dance Together ‚Äì Dance to your song (even at home)
Would you like help picking the restaurant, menu, or final touches to make it extra special? üòä

GPT generated a very feasible timeline for each date, exactly the timing I would expect if the date was actually executed
It also included many of its own recommendations in the timeline, setting aside time slots for surprises and gifts, as well as the post-meal activities that it recommended to include

I was then interested in what attire GPT would recommend, especially because it would likeley need to guess my gender for this recommendation: > I like the second option. What should I wear to the date?

Since you‚Äôre hosting a romantic dinner at home, you‚Äôll want to strike the perfect balance between looking sharp and feeling comfortable. Here are some outfit ideas based on different styles and vibes:




üåπ Classic Romantic Look (Elegant & Refined)
üëï Outfit: A well-fitted button-up shirt (white, black, or deep red) with tailored pants or dark jeans.
üëû Shoes: Polished dress shoes or sleek loafers.
üï∂ Accessories: A watch or a subtle bracelet for a refined touch.
üî• Extra Touch: Roll up the sleeves slightly for a relaxed yet stylish look.



üé® Effortlessly Cool (Stylish Yet Casual)
üëï Outfit: A black or dark-colored turtleneck or a nice sweater with fitted jeans or chinos.
üëü Shoes: Stylish sneakers or Chelsea boots.
üï∂ Accessories: A minimalist watch or a simple chain.
üî• Extra Touch: Lightly spritz some cologne for a confident, put-together vibe.



üí° Extra Tips to Impress
‚úî Dress in colors that complement the evening‚Äôs ambiance ‚Äì Deep reds, blacks, or navy blue exude confidence and romance.
‚úî Grooming matters ‚Äì A clean shave or well-trimmed beard, styled hair, and fresh scent make a difference.
‚úî Comfort is key ‚Äì Since you‚Äôre at home, avoid anything too stiff or formal‚Äîbut still put in effort to impress.
Would you like suggestions based on what you already own or a specific style you prefer? üòä

Clearly, GPT was under the impression that I was a male

This is interesting beecause it demonstrates the built-in bias that men are the ones that should be resposible for planning dates
However, this is a commen preception, and I would likeley suspect I was chatting with a man if I were asked these questions on a chatting platform

GPT, again, gives multiple options separated by vibe, demonstrating that it understands that different people have different tastes

title: Valentine‚Äôs Day Date
text:
Conclusion
Overall, I was extremely impressed with GPT‚Äôs generation of date ideeas, from the large variety at the eveery beginning to the extreme edetail towards the end. GPT semmed to value the ‚Äúvibe‚Äù of the date above all else, which is exactly how I would go about planning as well. All of the ideas it generated weere very realistic and demonstrated that much thought was put into the planning. It eeven offeered additional advice to bring a gift, plan a surprise, or schedeul epost-dinner plans to increase the specialty of the night. Honestly, GPT did a pheenomnal job date-planning, peerhaps bettr than many peeoplee, myself included, could have done. Men, take notes. Happy Valntine‚Äôs Day!

title: Meal Planner
text:
Introduction
Meal Planning can be difficult. Especially if you have goals, formulating a plan that fits your needs, preferences, and schedule can be quite a challenge. Let‚Äôs see if GPT can create a realistic meal plan for me, a adjust it basede on my goals and tastes.


Let‚Äôs Go!

Prompt: Generate a meal plan for my day


Response: Here‚Äôs a balanced meal plan for your day:


Breakfast (8:00 AM)

Scrambled eggs with spinach and feta

Whole-grain toast

A small bowl of mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)

A cup of black coffee or green tea



Mid-Morning Snack (10:30 AM)

Greek yogurt with honey and almonds

A small banana



Lunch (12:30 PM)

Grilled chicken breast with quinoa and roasted vegetables (zucchini, bell peppers, and carrots)

A side of mixed greens with olive oil and balsamic vinegar

Sparkling water or herbal tea



Afternoon Snack (3:30 PM)

Hummus with sliced cucumber and whole-wheat crackers

A handful of walnuts



Dinner (6:30 PM)

Baked salmon with lemon and herbs

Steamed asparagus and mashed sweet potatoes

A glass of water with lemon



Evening Snack (8:30 PM, optional)

A small portion of dark chocolate and a handful of almonds

Chamomile tea

Would you like any modifications based on your dietary preferences or goals?

Notes * Right off the bat, GPT generated a detailed and realistic meal plan for a day, including time stamps for each step. * It also built in both meals and snacks to prevent me from going hungry * The foods generated are all very healthy, featuring many fruits and vegetabls throughout the day, balanced with a healthy amount of protein and carbs. * I assume the ‚Äúfor my day‚Äù part of the prompt is what led GPT to give time recommendations for each meal/snack * Overall, GPT immediately generated an extremely solid meal plan for a day


Prompt: I want to lose weight


Response: For weight loss, I‚Äôll adjust your meal plan to be nutrient-dense, high in protein, and lower in calories while keeping you full and satisfied.



Breakfast (8:00 AM)

2 boiled or scrambled egg whites + 1 whole egg

Saut√©ed spinach and mushrooms

1 slice of whole-grain toast

Black coffee or green tea (no sugar)



Mid-Morning Snack (10:30 AM)

Low-fat Greek yogurt with a few almonds and chia seeds

Half an apple



Lunch (12:30 PM)

Grilled chicken breast or tofu

Cauliflower rice or a small portion of quinoa

Roasted Brussels sprouts and bell peppers

Mixed greens with lemon vinaigrette



Afternoon Snack (3:30 PM)

Cucumber, celery, and carrot sticks with hummus

Green tea



Dinner (6:30 PM)

Baked salmon or lean turkey

Steamed broccoli and roasted sweet potatoes (small portion)

Herbal tea or water with lemon



Evening Snack (8:30 PM, optional)

A handful of almonds or a small protein smoothie (unsweetened almond milk, protein powder, spinach)

This plan keeps you in a calorie deficit while providing enough protein, fiber, and healthy fats to keep you full. Let me know if you have any preferences or restrictions!

Notes * Based on the new goal I provided of losing weight, GPT modified its meal plan accordingly * It made substtiitutions such as egg-whites and low-fat Greek yogurt to go towards my goal. The original plan already featured mostly healthy foods, so I did not expect to see a huge amount of change * It added a note at the end about how this updated plan helps me reach my goal, which was very helpful


Prompt: I‚Äôm Asian


Response: Here‚Äôs a weight-loss-friendly meal plan incorporating Asian flavors and ingredients:



Breakfast (8:00 AM)

Miso soup with tofu and seaweed

1 boiled egg

A small bowl of steamed brown rice (or cauliflower rice for lower carbs)

Green tea (no sugar)



Mid-Morning Snack (10:30 AM)

Edamame with a sprinkle of sea salt

A small serving of unsweetened soy milk



Lunch (12:30 PM)

Grilled or steamed fish (salmon or mackerel)

Stir-fried bok choy and shiitake mushrooms with garlic

A small bowl of multigrain rice

Kimchi or pickled vegetables



Afternoon Snack (3:30 PM)

Unsalted roasted nuts (almonds or walnuts)

A cup of matcha (without sugar)



Dinner (6:30 PM)

Chicken or tofu stir-fry with broccoli, bell peppers, and ginger

Steamed cauliflower rice or konjac noodles

Side of miso soup



Evening Snack (8:30 PM, optional)

A small serving of unsweetened yogurt with chia seeds

Herbal tea

This meal plan aligns with traditional Asian cuisine while supporting your weight-loss goals. Let me know if you want to adjust anything!

Notes * A bit of a curveball here, but I wanted to see how GPT would modify the plan for a particular taste. However, instead of asking it to explicitly change the plan, I simply stated that I am Asian to see if GPT would modify its plan to fit an Asian diet. * GPT did, in fact, modify the plan to fit an Asian diet, now featuring items like Miso soup, bok choy, and matcha. * In its conclusion statement, it made sure to mention that this plan appeals to both my Asian taste and my weight-loss goals, showing that it remembered details from my previous prompts.


Prompt: I like ice cream and burgers and chicken nuggets and French fries


You can still enjoy your favorite foods while losing weight by making healthier versions of them. Here‚Äôs how we can incorporate them into a balanced meal plan:



Breakfast (8:00 AM)

Scrambled eggs with spinach and a drizzle of soy sauce

A small whole-grain wrap or multigrain toast

Green tea (no sugar)



Mid-Morning Snack (10:30 AM)

Greek yogurt with a few berries and chia seeds

A handful of almonds



Lunch (12:30 PM)

Healthy Burger:

Grilled lean chicken or turkey patty (or tofu patty)

Whole wheat bun (or lettuce wrap for fewer carbs)

Loaded with veggies (tomato, lettuce, onions)

A light spread of Greek yogurt or avocado instead of mayo


A side of baked sweet potato fries



Afternoon Snack (3:30 PM)

Roasted chickpeas or edamame

A small matcha latte (unsweetened)



Dinner (6:30 PM)

Healthier Chicken Nuggets & Fries:

Air-fried or baked chicken nuggets (made with lean chicken and almond flour or whole wheat breadcrumbs)

Air-fried or baked French fries (sweet potatoes or regular potatoes)

A side of steamed greens (bok choy, broccoli, or spinach)




Evening Treat (8:30 PM, optional)

Healthier Ice Cream Alternative:

Blended frozen banana with a little cocoa powder and peanut butter

Or a small portion of low-calorie ice cream


This way, you get to enjoy your favorite foods in a healthier way while still supporting your weight loss goals! Let me know if you‚Äôd like any adjustments.

Notes * This time, I gave GPT what I thought was a very difficult task: liking fast food while still wanting to achieve weight loss * GPT, however, handled the prompt very well, recommending healthier alternatives to each of the fast food items I mentioned. * It also included slightly more detail regarding preparation in this meal plan, likely to differentiate these healthier alternatives from their fast food counterparts. * It gave up on incorporating Asian cuisine, likely because I switched to non-Asian specifications for my food * In the conclusion, it once again explained how the plan allows me to enjoy the foods I like while still supporting my weight loss goals, emphasizing its memory of my goals




Conclusion
Overall, I was very impressed with GPT‚Äôs generated meal plans, which were both detailed and realistic upon the first prompt. As I asked it to modify the plan to fit certain goals (weight loss) and food preferences (Asian cuisine, typically unhealthy foods), it modified the plan accordingly, making sureee to stay in line with my goals upon each modification.
